intro: Gomphia microdonta, commonly known as the small-fruited gomphia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and edible plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and small, green, palmately lobed leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Gomphia microdonta is often found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
